definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
cancers of the nose and throat/nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC)
Eustachian tube (linking pharynx 咽 to tympanic cavity 鼓室 of middle ear)/auditory tube
to secure a stranglehold (idiom); fig. to hold a strategic pass

sentences.english: No Corynebacterium diphtheriae was isolated from the nasopharyngeal swabs, neither of the patient nor of the close contacts.

sentences.chinese: 它一直用它的三個腦袋來毀壞併吞咽所有東西。

sentences.english: She shook her head and swallowed a bite of croissant .

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the therapeutical effect of uvula - preserving uvulopalatopharyngoplasty ( UPPP ).

sentences.english: No patient demonstrated clinically significant postoperative velopharyngeal incompetence after 14 weeks.

sentences.english: Sometimes you need a kick in the teeth to get up and going again and to concentrate on the basics.
sentences.chinese: 有時候你需要打碎了牙往肚裏咽，專注於基礎。

definition: to be on the verge of saying what is on one's mind
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
